TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi PrintServer extends System.Printing.PrintSystemObject

Docs.summary: Manages the print queues on a print server, which is usually a computer, but can be a dedicated hardware print server appliance.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When your program writes a value to a property of <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer>, that change has no effect until it is passed on to the computer that is represented by the <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer> object. To commit changes, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer.Commit%2A> method for the object.
Similarly, other applications may change the actual print service properties of the computer. To make sure that the <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer> object for your program has the latest values, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer.Refresh%2A> method for the object.
> [!CAUTION] > Classes within the <xref:System.Printing> namespace are not supported for use within a Windows service or ASP.NET application or service. Attempting to use these classes from within one of these application types may produce unexpected problems, such as diminished service performance and run-time exceptions.
If you want to print from a Windows Forms application, see the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing> namespace.
## Examples The following example shows how to create an instance of <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Commit() cil managed

Docs.summary: Commits any changes that your program made to the properties of the print server object by writing them to the print server that the object represents.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The method requires that the <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer> object be created with <xref:System.Printing.PrintSystemDesiredAccess.AdministrateServer> rights.

MemberSignature.Usage: printServer.InstallPrintQueue (printQueueName, driverName, portNames, printProcessorName, printQueueAttributes, printQueueProperty, printQueuePriority, printQueueDefaultPriority)

Docs.param: The name of the new queue.
The path and name of the printer driver.
The IDs of the ports that the new queue uses.
The name of the print processor.
The attributes, as flags, of the new queue.
The comment, location, or share name of the new queue.
A value from 1 through 99 that specifies the priority of this print queue relative to other queues that are hosted by the print server.
A value from 1 to 99 that specifies the default priority of print jobs that are sent to the queue.
Docs.summary: Installs a prioritized print queue, and associated printer driver, on the print server.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the `printQueueProperty` parameter to initialize one, and only one, of the queue's <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.ShareName%2A>, <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.Comment%2A>, or <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.Location%2A> properties. If you want to initialize more than one, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer.InstallPrintQueue%28System.String%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.String%5B%5D%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.Printing.PrintQueueAttributes%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.Int32%2CSystem.Int32%29> overload of this method.

.method public hidebysig instance class System.Printing.PrintQueue InstallPrintQueue(string printQueueName, string driverName, string[] portNames, string printProcessorName, valuetype System.Printing.PrintQueueAttributes printQueueAttributes, string printQueueShareName, string printQueueComment, string printQueueLocation, string printQueueSeparatorFile, int32 printQueuePriority, int32 printQueueDefaultPriority) cil managed

MemberSignature.Usage: printServer.InstallPrintQueue (printQueueName, driverName, portNames, printProcessorName, printQueueAttributes, printQueueShareName, printQueueComment, printQueueLocation, printQueueSeparatorFile, printQueuePriority, printQueueDefaultPriority)

Docs.param: The name of the new queue.
The path and name of the printer driver.
The IDs of the ports that the new queue uses.
The name of the print processor.
The attributes, as flags, of the new queue.
The share name of the new queue.
A comment about the queue that is visible to users in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_win](~/includes/tlasharptla-win-md.md)] UI.
The location of the new queue.
The path of a file that is inserted at the beginning of each print job.
A value from 1 through 99 that specifies the priority of the queue relative to other queues that are hosted by the print server.
A value from 1 through 99 that specifies the default priority of new print jobs that are sent to the queue.
Docs.summary: Installs a shared, prioritized print queue, and associated printer driver, on the print server.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If you do not want to initialize all three of the queue's <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.ShareName%2A>, <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.Comment%2A>, or <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.Location%2A> properties; you can pass an empty string for one or more of `printQueueShareName`, `printQueueComment`, and `printQueueLocation`. If you want to initialize just one of these properties, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer.InstallPrintQueue%28System.String%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.String%5B%5D%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.Printing.PrintQueueAttributes%2CSystem.Printing.PrintQueueStringProperty%2CSystem.Int32%2CSystem.Int32%29> overload of this method.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the thread priority for the process that manages I/O through the printer ports.
Docs.value: A enumeration value that identifies the thread priority for the process that manages the printer ports. The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The port thread for the server reads the spool file, processes the data, and sends the data to a port monitor, which then sends the data to the printer.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Refresh() cil managed

Docs.summary: Updates the properties of the object so that each property value matches the corresponding attribute value of the print server that the object represents.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Any changes that you make to the properties of a <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer> can be lost when the <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer.Refresh%2A> method executes. This loss occurs if you did not yet write the changes to the print server that the object represents with <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer.Commit%2A>.

Docs.exception: Some of the properties cannot be refreshed.

member this.RestartJobOnPoolEnabled : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether users can restart jobs after an error occurs if printer pooling is enabled.
Docs.value: if jobs can be restarted when printer pooling is enabled; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks A calling program must have administrative permissions to set this value.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int RestartJobOnPoolTimeout { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.RestartJobOnPoolTimeout : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the wait time before a job can be restarted, if an error occurs when printer pooling is also enabled.
Docs.value: The wait time, in minutes, before a job restarts.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A calling program must have administrative permissions to set this value.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Threading::ThreadPriority SchedulerPriority { System::Threading::ThreadPriority get(); void set(System::Threading::ThreadPriority value); };
member this.SchedulerPriority : System.Threading.ThreadPriority with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the thread priority for the process that routes print jobs from applications to print queues.
Docs.value: A enumeration value that identifies the thread priority for the print server scheduling process. The default is .

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property SubSystemVersion As Byte
public: property System::Byte SubSystemVersion { System::Byte get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the version of the print spooler system.
Docs.value: A that identifies the version of the print spooler system.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In practice, the value of this property is always the same as the value of <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer.MajorVersion%2A> except that the latter is a type <xref:System.Int32>.
